      • remove

        public java.lang.Object remove(int value)
        (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AVL_tree) 1. If node X is a leaf or has only one child, skip to step 5. (node Z will be node X) 2. Otherwise, determine node Y by finding the largest node in node X's left sub tree (in-order predecessor) or the smallest in its right sub tree (in-order successor). 3. Replace node X with node Y (remember, tree structure doesn't change here, only the values). In this step, node X is essentially deleted when its internal values were overwritten with node Y's. 4. Choose node Z to be the old node Y. 5. Attach node Z's subtree to its parent (if it has a subtree). If node Z's parent is null, update root. (node Z is currently root) 6. Delete node Z. 7. rebalance
        Parameters:
        value -
